* People who live in social rented accommodation are more likely to identify as being of ‘White Scottish’ ethnicity (86%) compared to adults privately renting (57%), buying with a mortgage (81%) and adults in households owned outright (82%).
* Adults who identify as being of an ethnicity other than 'White Scottish' are more likely to live in the private rented sector compared to other tenures. This includes those who identify as 'White Other British' (16%), 'White Polish' (5%), 'White Other' (12%), 'Asian, Asian Scottish or Asian British' (1%), and 'Other ethnic group' (2%).
